hackathon-description-text: The Evernote Devcup is our annual developer competition for designers and software developers. With the help of our online community, we will award prizes to the best products that integrate with the Evernote API. Participants will be working on building apps and services that effectively use features within the Evernote service.
hackathon-rules:
Please note that Evernote has moved into new offices since these rules were initially published. The new address, which can be used to request a list of winning submissions or to access and withdrawal of your personal data, is:
Evernote Devcup
Evernote Corporation
305 Walnut Street
Redwood City, CA 94063
USA
 

The following is a summary of the competition process and rules. For full details, please see the official Devcup Rules below.
 
EVERNOTE DEVCUP OFFICIAL RULES
4836-4364-9295, v. 1
 
Additional content.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Five finalists chosen by Evernote experts. $10,000 cash prize, and airfare and lodging to attend the Evernote Trunk Conference.
A finalist chosen by the online community. $10,000 cash prize, and airfare and lodging to attend the Evernote Trunk Conference.
Awarded at the Evernote Trunk Conference.

$1,200 cash prize and airfare and lodging to attend the Evernote Trunk Conference. (Developers in Japan Only)

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the application polished, visually appealing, and easy to use?
Does the application take advantage of the unique functionality offered by the Evernote platform?
Is the application compelling and/or indispensable?
Is the application unique and/or innovative?

hackathon-description-header: Build the next generation of memorable apps using the Evernote platform.
